data.title: Awesome food, great beer selection
data.text: My wife and I hit up Bar 101 for the first time and we were impressed.  I had a burger and it was one of the best burgers I've had for some time.  My wife was equally impressed with her meal as well.  The beer selection was great with lots of local selections.  The service was good and friendly.  We could not have had a better experience.  We'll be back.

data.title: Good Food in a Great Location
data.text: My husband and I decided to try this place out after hearing really good things about this place. I love Historic Roseville. I love all the old buildings and being surrounded by transcontinental railroad history. Nice and cozy inside. Wait staff was quick and friendly. They have about 27 beers on top as well as various wines and cocktails. My husband had the special if the day, a patty melt, and I had a taco salad with carnitas. Good portions and the food was delicious. My only gripe is that the chips included in the salad were overly salty. Overall, we had a great experience and will be back!

data.title: Nice bar scene
data.text: Visited on a Friday night. Great burgers with the usual dive bar decorations. Great service and ice cold beers. Great place to people watch. Caveat if you are seated near the billiards table; gets loud quickly and you will not be able to carry on a conversation.

data.title: Great
data.text: This is a wonderful place to go. Greatest Bartendars and Abe is the bomb. Can't ask for a better place. Go there and find out for yourself.

data.title: A good burger
data.text: My daughter was performing here at open Mic. The menu was tempting including their interesting appetizers like the Beer Battered onion rings, garlic fries, chicken strips, loaded nachos. The one appetizer that intrigued me the most was the Carnitas Fries topped with carnitas, melted jack and cheddar cheese, homemade guacamole, sour cream, pick de Galla, jalapeños and green onions. We did succumbed to the garlic fries topped with seasoned garlic, parsley & Parmesan cheese. They were delicious.  Try the happy hour too.

data.title: Lord... the burgers!!!!
data.text: I really REALLY love this place. I read another review... it's NOT your regular bar fare. It's better. It's fresher. They have amazing salads. They make their own dressings. They slow cook their meats. Their burgers are never dry, always tasty (and are going to be the death of me) and their fries are not greasy. The opposite of everything I just said would make it "regular" bar fare. If you ever are in the area and want a good burger and brew, even for lunch!! Go here. They have every sporting event on for every season. Friendly owners (Manny and Shaleen) Amazing Staff (Jim) and even more so... AWESOME regulars. Don't let the name fool you. Unless it's after 9pm, this is a well priced, yummy, family establishment. Love this place!

data.title: Local watering hole
data.text: We are regulars here. Food is regular bar fare (burgers, fries, etc.) but with some nice additions like sweet chili shrimp, a very decent calamari, triple grilled cheese, and southwest chicken sandwich. Bartenders are friendly and seem to like working there, the owners are often there. Monday night is trivia night, tuesday is $1 taco night. They have open mic night and karaoke, sometimes live music on weekends. Good for couples, family, business, solo, just to hang out

data.title: Neighborhood watering hole
data.text: Great place for a nice meal and a beverage. Friendly owner and bartenders. Nice family atmosphere. Good food too! Monday night is trivia night. Taco Tuesday, $1 beef or chicken tacos. Open mic night, karaoke  (Wednesday and Thursday?) and live music on weekends.  Good for couples, dates, families, friends, solo, business get togethers.
